headline: Ignis Caret
description: A brief, poetic meditation on rest and purpose. This piece uses Latin symbolism and elemental metaphor to reflect on the necessity of fire — both literal and figurative — to maintain the integrity of the blade and the self.
whyItMatters: Because it marks a necessary lull — a symbolic rest in the cycle of output. A forge untended becomes brittle. The silence here is the shape of discipline, not absence.
articleExcerpt:
A forge under fire will crack
But dormant too long
and it forgets the ring of the hammer
sourceFragments: Not much today. A REST Day
It forgets the ring of the hammer

associatedMedia.description: A dark figure stands before a glowing forge. Overlaid Latin reads: FORNAX IGNIS CARET, GLADIUS FRANGETUR — The forge lacks fire, the sword will shatter.
